problem: I can't wake up early to go to the gym.

conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I can't wake up early to go to the gym.

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: Thanks for sharing! What is your weekday and weekend schedule like?

conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I usually sleep at 1 AM and wake up at 8 AM for work. Weekends I sleep until 11.

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: Got it. And what creates the most friction? What distracts you the most from your goal?

conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I just doomscroll on my phone in bed instead of getting up.

root_causes: Inconsistent sleep schedule disrupting circadian rhythm.
High friction to start (gym clothes not ready).
steps: Set a 'no phone' rule for first 20 mins of waking.
Prepare gym bag and clothes the night before.
Use the '5 Second Rule' to get out of bed immediately.

timeline.day_1_to_3: Focus solely on waking up at 7am, even if you don't go to gym.
timeline.day_4_to_7: Add putting on gym clothes immediately after waking.
timeline.week_2: Go to gym for just 15 mins (low pressure).
timeline.week_3_to_4: Build up to full standard workout routine.

final_plan.psychology_tip: Action creates motivation, not the other way around. Don't wait to 'feel' like going.
action_plan_24h: Tonight: Pack bag, phone charger away from bed.
Tomorrow 7:00 AM: Alarm rings, stand up immediately.
Tomorrow 7:15 AM: Drink water, shoes on, out the door.
